sentences.en: Comet also sired the champion foal out of Spinway Harvest.
sentences.cn: “彗星”还跟“斯平威·哈维斯特”生下了这匹出类拔萃的小马驹。

sentences.en: Did you ever see a comet?
Halley's Comet is going to come back in 2061.
If I had binoculars, I could see that comet clearly.
sentences.cn: 如果我有望远镜, 我就可以清楚地看见那颗彗星.

sentences.en: Recently they have discovered a comet.
sentences.cn: 最近他们发现了一颗彗星.

sentences.en: That comet is invisible to the unaided eye.
sentences.cn: 那颗彗星只用肉眼是看不到的.

sentences.en: The comet is going to come back in 2061 and we are all going to be able to see it. Well, our offspring are, anyway.
sentences.cn: 彗星将在2061年返回，到时我们都看得到。噢，反正我们的子孙看得到。

sentences.en: The comet nucleus itself is too small to hold on to these gases through gravitation.
sentences.cn: 慧核本身太小,它的引力不足以束缚住这些气体.

sentences.en: The Comet, for example, was really only a fancy Falcon.
sentences.cn: 例如, 慧星型车实际上不过是一部花哨的猎鹰车而已.

sentences.en: The emperor's long beard streamed in the wind like the tail of a flaming red comet.
sentences.cn: 这位国王的长胡须迎风飘扬,宛如燃烧着的红色慧星的尾巴.

sentences.en: The orbit of this comet intersects the orbit of the Earth.
sentences.cn: 这颗彗星的轨道与地球的轨道交叉。

sentences.en: They predicted accurately every eclipse of the moon and sun, the return of every comet.
sentences.cn: 他们正确地预报每一次月蚀和日蚀, 每一次慧星的出现.

sentences.en: This nucleus has captured the slow - moving neutrons; The star captured a comet.
sentences.cn: 这核子已经俘获慢运动的中子; 这颗恒星俘获了一颗慧星.

sentences.en: We were not altogether sure that the comet would miss the Earth.
sentences.cn: 我们不能完全肯定彗星不会与地球相撞。

sentences.en: What happened the games began, a comet appeared in the sky.
sentences.cn: 在比赛开始后, 天空出现了一刻彗星.

trans.tran_en: an object in space like a bright ball with a long tail, that moves around the sun
